name: Chateau Saint-Martin & Spa

reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel with excellent service standards. We only went to the less formal restaurant which served great food with fantastic views. Ws were given room 8 which was very spacious with a fantastic balcony with great views. Sadly it was also under the restaurant and because we are light sleepers we had a very disturbed first night. However, the manager was very sympathetic and we upgraded to an exquisite bastide/villa for the rest of our stay.
reviews.title: Luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During a 4-week trip around Europe I stayed at about 7 different luxury hotels, and this was the highlight.
reviews.title: The highlight of a 4-week trip around Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful, large property, great view from our suite, fantastic 2-star Michelin onsite restaurant, and out of this world service.
reviews.title: This is an exceptionally good, classy and grown-up hotel

reviews.text: If you are anywhere in southern France, you owe it to yourself to spend 2 or 3 nights at this property.
reviews.title: Extraordinary, the reviews are unanimous!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a few nights at the Chateau Saint- Martin over three hot June days. The experience was really quite excellent -here is a beautiful, 40 room hotel in tip-top condition, classy but in no way flash and with impeccable service from top-class staff. Its setting is sublime; in the hills just above Vence (which we prefer to Saint Paul de Vence as it has more integrity), and its gardens are fabulous, with a great pool.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a hotel!!!!! If you are looking for a peaceful, tranquil and drop dead gorgeous setting, this hotel is a place for you! With the amazing gardens, fantastic decor and the breathtaking view from the suit it does not get much better then this!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with unprecedented service and surrouding!!!!

reviews.text: There are three different restaurants in this hotel. We went to the "Grill" restaurant in the hotel. Service was fantastic but food was overpriced and did not live up to the expectations. Breakfast is of your standard four-star hotel with the limited choices.
reviews.title: spectacular, faultless, every bit a 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, this hotel offers the level of luxury and class that is rare to come across in the US. You will enjoy the privacy and the chick of the seclusion of the high class hotel.
reviews.title: I am picky and everything was excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spectacular location on a hilltop with far reaching views towards Nice. we had room with terrace (600 euros a night) 1st class room, bathroom, tv full amenities. Secure parking, full tour of hotel. Great mattresses, superb bathroom and great hot power shower separate from bath. Gym and pool facilities 1st class. relaxing atmosphere, spotlessly clean. Every member of staff down to the cleaners ALL acknowledged your presence whenever a guest entered a room. great marketing, making us feel really welcome.
reviews.title: Exquisite Property with great staff and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel isnt cheap but do they earn every single penny. Will be returning again.,
reviews.title: Great service, lovely rooms but a little bit stuffy

reviews.text: Excellent hotel, but service in bar and restaurant very poor. Stayed 2 nights. Terrible service in bar and restaurant every day. Buffet selections not every good for a hotel of this quality.
reviews.title: Great location and rooms. Weak service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a Relais and Chateaux property run by the same people who run the Eden Roc at Antibes. It is in the hills above Vence set next to the ruins of a castle built by the Knights Templar. It is about 15 mins drive from St Paul de Vence.
reviews.title: Glorious hotel in the hills near Vence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms and bathrooms are large, beautifully appointed and feature splendid views over the Cote d’Azur. The dining terrace has one of the most magnificent views in Provence and breakfast on it is a must, as are champagne and canapés before dinner. The grounds are a delight and swimming pool water temperature is kept at 30 degrees.
reviews.title: Elegant, peaceful, and pretty
A disaster
reviews.text: The staff were attentive, helpful and generally outstanding. Even the laundry was perfection in both quality and presentation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a few days R and R away from the hustle and bustle of the French Riviera, stay here awhile. You won’t be disappointed.
reviews.title: lovely and elegant retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful! Excellent place, perhaps one of the best on the French riviera.
reviews.title: Is this paradise?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent Michelin starred restaurant with stunning views. Park and gardens are beyond compare and the Spa La Praire a must. Go to relax outof the crowds of the coast.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: One of the Jewels of the Cote d'Azur.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in the world - really!

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Chateau St. Martin and absolutely loved it. It is beautifully maintained and we had a sun filled room overlooking the terrace and looking out to the sea. The staff was extremely accomodating and the public areas are elegant. The infinity swimming pool is peaceful and in a garden surrounded by olive trees. We did not have the time to vist the spa but would definately do so on our next trip. It is expensive, but definately worth it.
reviews.title: Amazing place on the French Riviera

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at Chateau St. Martin several times over the past 5-6 years. On absolutely every front, this is one of the most enjoyable hotels we have ever experienced (and we have stayed in 50-100 Four Seasons, Ritz, and boutique hotels all over the world). The setting is amazing, the service incredibly personal, friendly and zealous, the food outstanding. I cannot rave enough about this establishment. Our two daughters have been dreaming to get married there ever since their first stay when they were 8-9 years old! There is no better place to stay in the Nice/Cannes area.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but what’s going on in the swimming pool?

description: Château Saint-Martin & Spa, located between Nice and Cannes, overlooks majestically the typical Provençal village of Vence and the shores of the French Riviera. Set in 32 acres of Private Park on the ruins of an ancient knight’s templar, this Relais & Chateau of excellence offers 52 Junior Suites including 6 private villas. “Le Saint-Martin” restaurant was awarded with two Michelin Stars in 201! “La Rôtisserie”.
